units.unitName: Ordinary differential equations of higher orders

Random variables: Discrete and continuous random variables, Probability mass function and probability density function, Joint distributions, Marginal and conditional distributions and moments, Moment generating function.
Discrete Probability Distributions: Binomial, Poisson and Geometric distributions, Continuous distributions: Uniform, Normal, Exponential, Gamma distributions.
Historical development of optimization techniques, Formulation of LPP, Graphical method, Convexity, Simplex method, Big M-method, Two-phase method.
Classical Optimization using Differential Calculus, Single variable optimization, Multivariable Optimization with/without constraints, Lagrange’s Method.
Linear Programming: Duality, Sensitivity analysis, Transportation problem, Assignment problem.
Introduction to Technical Communication: Process of Communication, Language as a tool of communication, Technical communication: meaning, importance and role.
Comprehension of Technical Materials/Texts and Information Design & Development: Reading techniques, summarizing, abstracting, information collection, organization and presentation.
Technical Writing, Grammar and Editing: Technical style, technical definitions, technical descriptions, technical manuals, grammar usage and common errors.
Advanced Technical Writing: Research papers, project reports, dissertations, proposals, technical emails.
Basic Economic Concepts: Meaning, nature and scope of economics; basic economic problems; scarcity and choice; national income.
Demand and Supply Analysis: Demand forecasting, elasticity of demand, supply function, elasticity of supply.
Production and Cost Analysis: Production function, laws of returns to scale, least cost combination, isoquants, cost curves.
Market structure and pricing theory: Perfect competition, monopoly, monopolistic competition, oligopoly.
Financial Statement Analysis: Balance sheet, P&L statements, cash-flow analysis, fund-flow analysis, financial ratios.
Fundamental Concepts: Number systems, binary codes, Boolean algebra, logic gate fundamentals.
Minimization Techniques and Logic Gates: K-map, simplification methods, combinational logic.
Digital Logic Gate Characteristics: Logic families, TTL, CMOS, interfacing.
Combinational Circuits: Encoders, decoders, multiplexers, de-multiplexers, adders, subtractors.
Sequential Circuits: Flip-flops, counters, shift registers, synchronous/asynchronous circuits.
Stacks: Stack implementation, applications, recursion, expression conversion.
Linked Lists and Queues: Types of linked lists, queue implementation, circular queues, priority queues.
Searching Techniques and Sorting: Linear search, binary search, quicksort, mergesort, heapsort.
Trees: Binary trees, AVL trees, B-trees, tree traversal techniques.
Graphs and Hashing: Graph representation, BFS, DFS, shortest path algorithms, hashing techniques.
Introduction: OOP concepts, classes and objects, constructors and destructors.
Dynamic Memory Allocation: Pointers, new/delete, dynamic constructors.
Inheritance: Types of inheritance, virtual base class, ambiguity resolution.
Operator Overloading: Unary and binary operator overloading.
File Handling: File streams, read/write operations.
Introduction: Software process models, software development life cycle.
Software Project Management: Project planning, cost estimation, scheduling.
Requirement Analysis: SRS, functional and non-functional requirements.
Software Design: Architectural design, modular design, user interface design.
Object-Oriented Analysis: UML diagrams, class diagrams, sequence diagrams.
Introduction: Objective, scope and outcome of the course.
Set Theory, Relation, Function: Countable/uncountable sets, cardinality, inclusion-exclusion principle, pigeonhole principle.
Propositional Logic: Logical operations, predicates, normal forms, quantifiers.
Posets, Hasse diagram, Lattices, Combinatorics, Recurrence Relations, Generating Functions.
Algebraic Structures: Groups, Rings, Fields, Commutativity, Homomorphism.
Graph Theory: Paths, cycles, connectivity, Eulerian/Hamiltonian paths, graph coloring.
Architecture of 8085 Microprocessor: Internal blocks, instruction cycle, addressing modes.
8085 Instruction Set and Programming: Data transfer, arithmetic, logical, branch instructions.
Introduction: Database concepts, data models, DBMS architecture.
Entity Relationship Model: Mapping cardinalities, keys, constraints.
Relational Algebra and Calculus, SQL Queries, Trigger Programming.
Concurrency Control, Database Failure and Recovery.
Introduction: Basics of automata theory and formal languages.
Tractable and Untractable Problems (P and NP Classes).
Introduction: Basics of data communication, network types, protocol architecture.
Data Transmission, Transmission Media, Channel Capacity.
Data Link Layer: Framing, Error control, Flow control.
Network Layer: Routing algorithms, Congestion control, IPv4/IPv6.
Transport Layer: TCP, UDP, Flow control, Connection management.
Application Layer: DNS, Email, FTP, HTTP.
Introduction to Compilers: Phases, compiler structure, front-end and back-end concepts.
Lexical Analysis: Tokens, lexemes, regular expressions, finite automata.
Syntax Analysis: Parsing techniques, LL and LR parsers, error recovery.
Semantic Analysis: Type checking, intermediate code generation.
Introduction to Operating Systems: Types, system calls, OS structure.
Process Management: Scheduling, threads, IPC, synchronization.
Memory Management: Paging, segmentation, virtual memory.
File Systems: Directories, allocation, free space management.
Basic Computer Organization: CPU, registers, buses.
Instruction Set Architecture and ALU Design.
Memory Organization: Cache, primary and secondary memory.
Control Unit: Hardwired and microprogrammed control.
Algorithm Analysis: Time/space complexity, asymptotic notation.
Foundations of AI, Intelligent Agents, Problem Solving.
Introduction: Project life cycle, characteristics of software projects.
Project Planning: Scope management, project estimation techniques.
Project Monitoring, Control and Configuration Management.
Introduction to Computer Graphics: Graphics pipeline, applications.
2D Transformations: Scaling, rotation, translation, homogeneous coordinates.
Curve and Surface Modeling: Bézier, B-spline curves.
Rendering Techniques: Illumination models, shading, ray tracing.
Introduction to Distributed Systems: Goals, challenges, architecture.
Fault Tolerance and Distributed File Systems.
Introduction to Data Mining: KDD process, types of data, data preprocessing.
Classification Techniques: Decision trees, Bayesian classifiers.
Cloud Computing Fundamentals: Virtualization, service models.
